title: Update color scheme and currency to Ghana Cedis

requirements.summary: Replace the current color scheme with user-provided color codes throughout the application theme
acceptanceCriteria: All OKLCH color variables in the CSS files are updated to match the provided color codes
The new colors are consistently applied across all pages (Dashboard, Products, Sales)
Light and dark mode variants use the new color palette
UI components (buttons, cards, tables, forms) reflect the updated color scheme

file_operations.description: Update all OKLCH color variables in :root and .dark selectors to use the user-provided color codes for primary, secondary, accent, background, foreground, card, muted, and border colors

Update all OKLCH color variables in :root and .dark selectors to match the new color scheme, ensuring consistency with frontend/index.css for primary, secondary, accent, background, foreground, card, muted, and border colors

requirements.summary: Change all currency displays to Ghana Cedis (GH₵) format
acceptanceCriteria: All monetary values display the GH₵ symbol prefix
Backend stores prices and amounts as numeric values without currency symbols
Frontend formats all displayed prices and amounts with 'GH₵' prefix and two decimal places
Currency formatting is consistent across ProductForm, ProductTable, SaleForm, TransactionHistory, RecentTransactions, and MetricCard components
Dashboard metric cards show inventory value and sales totals in Ghana Cedis format

file_operations.description: Update price input labels and placeholders to indicate Ghana Cedis (GH₵) for wholesalePricePees and retailPricePees fields
Update price display formatting in the Wholesale and Retail columns to show GH₵ prefix followed by the price value divided by 100 with two decimal places
Update total amount display to format the calculated total with GH₵ prefix and two decimal places, and update any price-related labels or placeholders to indicate Ghana Cedis
Update transaction amount display to format totalAmountPees with GH₵ prefix followed by the amount divided by 100 with two decimal places
Update all monetary value displays including transaction totals and individual item prices to show GH₵ prefix followed by the value divided by 100 with two decimal places

Update value prop formatting in components that pass monetary values to MetricCard to ensure they display with GH₵ prefix and two decimal places when rendering dashboard metrics for inventory value and sales totals

Update MetricCard value props for Total Inventory Value, Total Wholesale Sales, and Total Retail Sales to format monetary values with GH₵ prefix and two decimal places before passing to MetricCard components
